revised_title: Dentition and Growth Patterns in Wild Boar and Elephant Teeth
tldr: The author examines the structure and growth of grinding teeth in wild boars and compares them to the teeth of elephants and other animals. They observe similarities in the dentition of these animals and infer that they may have been intended for great longevity. The author also discusses the differences between the teeth of various animals and the possibility of different growth patterns.
